meanings.definition: To be taller than something else.
meanings.sent1: The skyscraper outtowered all the other buildings in the city.
meanings.sent2: The tree outtowered the bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe outtowered the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The mountain outtowered the surrounding hills.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outtowered the ships at sea, guiding them safely.

meanings.definition: To surpass in height or stature.
meanings.sent1: His ambition outtowered that of his peers, driving him to succeed.
meanings.sent2: Her achievements outtowered those of her competitors.
meanings.sent3: The cake outtowered all other desserts at the party, becoming the star.
meanings.sent4: The champion outtowered the rest of the players with his skill and determination.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outtowered the other flowers in the garden, reaching for the sky.
